definition: residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home

sentences.english: Old dwelling Wooden staircases, with the noise of creak when you set foot on it.
sentences.chinese: 《老宅院》木质的楼梯，踏上去咯吱咯吱地作响。

sentences.english: When I arrived at Limmeridge House, there was no sign of Mr Fairlie.
sentences.chinese: 我到了梨弥蕤界宅院，没有芾利先生的身影。

sentences.english: On her uncle's death, Limmeridge House now belonged to Laura.
sentences.chinese: 因为她叔叔的死，梨弥蕤界宅院现在属于瑙若了。

sentences.english: These houses has its own unique living life.
sentences.chinese: 这些宅院都有自己独特鲜活的生命。

sentences.english: On their way they passed a house, and saw a beautiful lady inside.
sentences.chinese: 他们在路上路过一处宅院，看到院子里有位美女。

sentences.english: IN DAYI COUNTY, Chinese tourists stroll through the meandering courtyards of a rural mansion.
sentences.chinese: 在大邑县，中国游客在蜿蜒曲折的乡间大宅院中漫步。

sentences.english: For over two decades, she had been the cleaning lady in a big house.
sentences.chinese: 她曾为同一栋大宅院做清洁工作，有二十多年之久。

sentences.english: Common house in both the caves of northern Shaanxi, also on the tile- roofed house in the rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 宅院中既有陕北常见的窑洞，也有关中农村的瓦房。

sentences.english: You are looking at the future owner of Limmeridge House.
sentences.chinese: 你看着梨弥蕤界宅院未来的拥有者。

definition: courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)
